t: John 18
Jesus Betrayed
After*p Jesus had said these things, he went out with his disciples across the Kidron Valley, where there was a garden, and he and his disciples went into it.
Judas, who betrayed him, also knew the place, because Jesus often met there with his disciples.
So Judas took a company of soldiers and some officials from the chief priests and the Pharisees and came there with lanterns, torches, and weapons.
Then*p Jesus, knowing everything that was about to happen to him, went out and said to them, “Who*r is*r it*r that*r you’re*r seeking?”*r
“Jesus*p of Nazareth,” they answered. “I*rp am*r he,”*r Jesus told them. Judas,*p who betrayed him, was also standing with them.
When Jesus told them, “I*r am*r he,”*r they stepped back and fell to the ground.
Then*p he asked them again, “Who*r is*r it*r that*r you’re*r seeking?”*r “Jesus*p of Nazareth,” they said.
“I*rp told*r you*r I*r am*r he,”*r Jesus replied. “So*r if*r you’re*r looking*r for*r me,*r let*r these*r men*r go.”*r
This was to fulfill the words he had said: “I*r have*r not*r lost*r one*r of*r those*r you*r have*r given*r me.”*r
Then*p Simon Peter, who had a sword, drew it, struck the high priest’s servant, and cut off his right ear. (The servant’s name was Malchus.)
At*p that, Jesus said to Peter, “Put*r your*r sword*r away!*r Am*r I*r not*r to*r drink*r the*r cup*r the*r Father*r has*r given*r me?”*r
Jesus Arrested and Taken to Annas
Then*p the company of soldiers, the commander, and the Jewish officials arrested Jesus and tied him up.
First they led him to Annas, since he was the father-in-law of Caiaphas, who was high priest that year.
Caiaphas was the one who had advised the Jews that it would be better for one man to die for the people.
Peter Denies Jesus
Simon*p Peter was following Jesus, as was another disciple. That disciple was an acquaintance of the high priest; so he went with Jesus into the high priest’s courtyard.
But Peter remained standing outside by the door. So the other disciple, the one known to the high priest, went out and spoke to the girl who was the doorkeeper and brought Peter in.
Then*p the servant girl who was the doorkeeper said to Peter, “You aren’t one of this man’s disciples too, are you?” “I*p am not,” he said.
Now the servants and the officials had made a charcoal fire, because it was cold. They were standing there warming themselves, and Peter was standing with them, warming himself.
Jesus before Annas
The*p high priest questioned Jesus about his disciples and about his teaching.

“I*rp have*r spoken*r openly*r to*r the*r world,”*r Jesus answered him. “I*r have*r always*r taught*r in*r the*r synagogue*r and*r in*r the*r temple,*r where*r all*r the*r Jews*r gather,*r and*r I*r haven’t*r spoken*r anything*r in*r secret.*r
Why*r do*r you*r question*r me?*r Question*r those*r who*r heard*r what*r I*r told*r them.*r Look,*r they*r know*r what*r I*r said.”*r
When*p he had said these things, one of the officials standing by slapped Jesus, saying, “Is this the way you answer the high priest?”
“If*rp I*r have*r spoken*r wrongly,”*r Jesus answered him, “give*r evidence*r about*r the*r wrong;*r but*r if*r rightly,*r why*r do*r you*r hit*r me?”*r
Then Annas sent him bound to Caiaphas the high priest.
Peter Denies Jesus Twice More
Now*p Simon Peter was standing and warming himself. They said to him, “You aren’t one of his disciples too, are you?” He*p denied it and said, “I am not.”
One*p of the high priest’s servants, a relative of the man whose ear Peter had cut off, said, “Didn’t I see you with him in the garden?”
Peter denied it again. Immediately a rooster crowed.
Jesus before Pilate

Then*p they led Jesus from Caiaphas to the governor’s headquarters. It was early morning. They did not enter the headquarters themselves; otherwise they would be defiled and unable to eat the Passover.
So*p Pilate came out to them and said, “What charge do you bring against this man?”
They*p answered him, “If this man weren’t a criminal, we wouldn’t have handed him over to you.”
Pilate*p told them, “You take him and judge him according to your law.” “It’s*p not legal for us to put anyone to death,” the Jews declared.
They said this so that Jesus’s words might be fulfilled indicating what kind of death he was going to die.
Then*p Pilate went back into the headquarters, summoned Jesus, and said to him, “Are you the king of the Jews?”
Jesus*p answered, “Are*r you*r asking*r this*r on*r your*r own,*r or*r have*r others*r told*r you*r about*r me?”*r
“I’m*p not a Jew, am I?” Pilate replied. “Your own nation and the chief priests handed you over to me. What have you done?”

“My*rp kingdom*r is*r not*r of*r this*r world,”*r said Jesus. “If*r my*r kingdom*r were*r of*r this*r world,*r my*r servants*r would*r fight,*r so*r that*r I*r wouldn’t*r be*r handed*r over*r to*r the*r Jews.*r But*r as*r it*r is,*r my*r kingdom*r is*r not*r from*r here.”*r

“You*p are a king then?” Pilate asked. “You*rp say*r that*r I’m*r a*r king,”*r Jesus replied. “I*r was*r born*r for*r this,*r and*r I*r have*r come*r into*r the*r world*r for*r this:*r to*r testify*r to*r the*r truth.*r Everyone*r who*r is*r of*r the*r truth*r listens*r to*r my*r voice.”*r
“What*p is truth?” said Pilate.
Jesus or Barabbas
After*p he had said this, he went out to the Jews again and told them, “I find no grounds for charging him.
You have a custom that I release one prisoner to you at the Passover. So, do you want me to release to you the king of the Jews?”
They*p shouted back, “Not this man, but Barabbas!” Now Barabbas was a revolutionary.
